review: Absolute worst part of the experience at this place are the drinks. No matter what you order, whether a martini or specialty drink, they water it down to the point that there's maybe 1/10th the normal amount of alcohol. Even when you ask the waiter or bartender for the stongest drink on the menu, its a sham. Unbelievably frustrating since every other restaurant I've been to since drinking age will serve a real drink, and this place charges just as much for drinks as any bar but without the alcohol. So if you want to take your kids to get ribs or fried shrimp, you'll be satisfied. But if you want a quality steak or something resembling a drink, don't waste your time here.

Surpassed my expectations in terms of a chain. Went for the black bean burger and replaced the cheese with hummus. The combo of this and avocado with onion and veggies was delicious. Paired with fries, it's not a light meal, but what can you do at a place like this? The service was quick and my server was friendly and mentioned my vegetarianism (without me mentioning it). I would come back here again if I was in the mood for this meal or checking out the spinach flat-bread dish. It's food for the standard american diet, but at least I had a tasty veg option.

The food at this restaurant is below average  - ribs always dry, salads mundane - but at least the burgers are up to par. Not so, last night, 1/9/2012. Undercooked bbq burger made me feel slightly sick afterwards. The pick 3 appetizer included the worst boneless wings I've ever had.
Fair.  If with friends just killing time. Food is average.  Service is hit or miss

I recently stopped here with a friend for a quick bite to eat. We were guided to a table where the bus boy was wiping down the seats. Thinking nothing of it, I sat down and then a huge drop of water dropped on my head. Turns out, they sat us under a leak. So needless to say, we requested to move tables. Once we did, we were sitting at the new table and literally saw a mouse run across the floor. When we brought this to the attention of out waiter, he said (and I quote), "Oh, well it's getting cold outside - it's the time of year they come in. Would you like me to move your table and give you a free dessert?" For the rest of our visit, I was so afraid a mouse would run across my feet and my friend was more concerned about the mouse having been in our food, etc. etc. We shared one appetizer, one drink and one meal. Our food was alright but I must say that the way the waiter handled the mouse was not.

I was here on Saturday night - no wait and kind of busy, it was after eight PM. I ordered a salad (the chipotle one with avocado) and specifically said no chicken. Someone other than our waitress brought the food out and there was chicken on my salad. The waitress came back, I said I was a vegetarian, and she took the salad to exchange it for another. The salad comes back...and clearly they just tried to remove the chicken from the top of it. It still had pieces of shredded chicken upon inspection, in plain sight!  Then it took forever to get our waitress again, who just took the plate away, without apologizing or offering me something else. Fifteen minutes later, the manager comes over and offers dessert for free. The waitress later comes back and apologizes, blaming the cook. I skipped the entree completely at that point and just got dessert.  It may sound petty to a nonveg, but I found it extremely disrespectful. It is against my morals to eat meat, and they tried to repackage a salad that costs little to make without consideration of me, the customer. Bottom line, would not come here again.
I had dinner here Friday night food was good . The service was good. But it is always to loud there would love it if they turned down the music some.

My husband and I were coming back from Delaware and decided to stop at this location for dinner. It was crowded for a weeknight, but before we knew it, there were several tables available. There were other small parties besides my husband and I, and we ended up to be the last to be seated, which I think they did that purposely. That was a thirty minute wait.  My husband has a bad leg, and not putting that into consideration, we were seated in the bar section which had steps. Our waitress was quite rude to us when we needed an extra set of silverware. Our food we ordered didn't reach our table until a half hour later (which by this time the restaurant wasn't crowded)  and our food was below par. TGI Friday's has gone downhill just like so many of the restaurant chains, and this wasn't the only TGI's that has given my husband and I poor service.  Unless TGI Friday's gets their act together in all their restaurants, my husband and I are not coming back!!!! My suggestion? DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!

It's not usually worth your time to write a review for a chain but here was my experience with this particular TGI Fridays. We were seated at a table.  We sat there for ten minutes. No one came over to even offer us water. We got up and left. The end.

Hate to do this, but lately the food at Fridays has been really bad/sub-par.  Not sure if they got a new chef or something.  However, within the last 3 times I've been here in the past month, each time I've asked for my steak "medium-well" it comes out tougher than a leather shoe, tasteless, and bland. Service is still pretty good as well as the atmosphere, HOWEVER, PLEASE LOOK INTO THIS.  I don't know if the cook has amnesia, dementia, or someone new has been hired, but the food is not nearly as good as it used to be.

In the last few years Fridays has been leaving a bad taste in my mouth. My boyfriend and I came for my birthday. We received our appetizer and it was luke lukewarm at best. Our waitress suggested a drink and for an 11 dollar drink I expected it to be a tad bit bigger but it was a regular glass size that I could use that 11 dollars to make many drinks at home. My birthday let our waitress know it was my birthday because they used to send over a dessert and sing to a person on their birthday, the waitress informed him they no longer do that, if he wanted them to sing he would have to purchase a dessert and he could pick any he likes.  This is something Fridays used to do and it was a nice gesture on their part and good customer relations, it was a little disappointing they do not do it anymore. For a multi billion dollar company  to be skimping on things like this and raise prices in other categories, they have most certainly changed. I know people who used to come here on their birthday but now I will let them know their policy has changed.

Yikes. I have always been a fan of the Fridays chain, but this location was yuck. Needs a good cleaning, first and foremost. The urine smell that lingered in the ladies room was not the smell I would've chosen to start my meal off. The stickiness of our table was enough to gross out Elmer's glue. Food was just meh. Got a chicken salad that ended up being a small piece of chicken on a huge plate of mostly lettuce. So bland. My man friend said his chicken meal was decent.  If I'm in the area looking for a quick bite again, I am planning on passing on this place. I am still skeezed out from the bathroom.

I'll put the caveat that I never really come here for the food. I come for cold beer and a laid back atmosphere.  The beer is always cold and the bartenders,  especially Evan, are very chill. I went a year without coming in but Evan remembered who I was and remembered my name. Doesn't seem like much but if someone can pay attention to detail on something small like a name, you can tell they are going to be solid at what they do. In this case, making a solid drink. I get the occasional appetizer and desert and they are good each time. Typical Fridays food, have never had a bad time. This is an EXCELLENT spot to have some drinks or dinner before catching a movie at the Marlton 8 movie theater.  Give it a shot, you may be surprised.

Came here for my bday today and it was very good. It had been a while since I've been to Fridays but I was really happy about the service in today's visit.  I had ordered Parmesan chicken which came with Mac & Cheese and the chicken and Mac & Cheese was coated with Parmesan seasoning and it complemented the dish very well and will probably get again. The wait staff was really nice, for dessert I got an Oreo ice cream sandwich which was tasty and is something I'll get agin.

It's Friday's. You know what you're getting into. It's definitely nothing special but it's usually not horrific. I went last with a small group before a movie at AMC and the appetizer deal was confused and the waitress charged us more - she didn't offer to take her mistake off the bill. Also there was a piece of plastic in my girlfriend's salad which we notified the waitress of but it wasn't a huge deal and she finished it... I thought we'd get some sort of comp. Disappointing. I'll probably never go back for dinner considering there's so many better options in the area. I'd go for lunch to get one of the sandwiches but the entrees are a waste of money.

Typical Fridays Food. I will say the burgers were on the better side than I remember. Fries were cold, but at 8pm NYE, I didn't care.  The issue I had was the waitress, who was lucky enough to have 4 of her friends get seated behind me 1/2 way through my meal. Once that happened, I couldnt get any service. She waited on them 3x, to my 1x.  This wont keep me from going back, but next time I will make sure that wont happen again.

I've eaten here a few times as I work right around the corner. We usually go for the unlimited apps. We get an hour lunch and the waitresses/waiters are usually pretty good with getting us in and out promptly. Food was always good too.  Never a bad experience here.

This used to be my favorite place to eat, no matter the location. However, recent times have seen the entire establishment (Corporate, locations, management, and employees) take a nosedive into places that are horrific. The amount of food served has been reduced, in some cases to less then half of what you would have gotten in recent months. All the while, price have been marked up more then 30% on some of the items that have been reduced. The management is lacking in even the most basic of control over their kitchen output, quality of food, and actions/professionalism of their staff. The locations have become dated, dirty and very unkempt. Walking in is almost as if you were walking into a very worn and abused 1980's restaurant that has seen many better days. I wish I could have posted a better review, but recent events in the Cherry Hill, Marlton, and 2 other locations have forced my hand. I would like to return and spend 2 or 3 nights a week enjoying food and friends at these locations, but that is not almost impossible. They take your points, and do not apply them to your bill at the end. A phone call over multiple days is needed to get any type of refund. Going to the men's room, well, take your health in your own hands for that one. If anyone knows where I can donate the points that I have (Over 1600 currently) let me know, I will more then willingly send them to a needed organization that can use them.

Ordered the pick three appetizers for three of us. We asked for the boneless wings to be served dry with two sauces on the side. Of course, it was served smothered in a sweet sauce that none of us liked!  We all agreed that the mozzarella sticks tasted strange. They must have changed the brand they use -- yuck. The fried green beans were great, but not plentiful. I ordered the full rib rack. At came dry, with the BBQ sauce served on the side, not based with the sauce while cooked. That's so strange!  Won't be going back there so fast. Saving grace was we had a buy one entree get one free, so we saved $19. It was July 4th and not crowded. There was no reason for so many mistakes made by the cook and server.

Will never venture into this restaurant again. Horrible service, Rude Waitress... NEVER!! I have been to plenty of casual to high end dining establishments and the general rule is always polite and friendly service

I've been to this location a couple times and I really enjoy it. The staff/service is great. I placed my order then changed my mind (typical woman!) and our waiter was so great about making the change for me. However, he forgot to take my original order off the bill, but got his manager to correct it without a problem. Our food came out quickly and was nice and hot, and delicious! This location does a great job of making sure tables get served quickly so you can make your movie in time (as the AMC theater is right there).

This location is mostly popular for the simple fact that you can dine here and walk over the AMC next door to watch a movie. The cocktails I find to be refreshing and original therefore I will never complain about having cocktails here before a movie. They also have lots of specials each day. If you sign up for their email promotions you will recieve notifcations of specials being ran and coupons for BOGO meals. The food on the other hand is overtly greasy and/or drenched in jack daniel's sauce. In all honesty the calories are really just not worth it. Our server was pretty attentive despite how busy they were, which was greatly appreciated.

I really overall am not a fan of TGI Fridays. This location gives me mixed feelings. Sometimes the wait staff is spot on, other times it's like pulling teeth to get them to check on you. I also feel that when a large group comes in that the waiter that we get cringes over a large group. Wouldn't you think they would be excited for a larger tip? Like the Yelp rating states it is just A-OK.

Tried the endless apps, and I'd say for chain food it was "decent". As far as choices, I have some recommendations. Stick with all options but the potato skins (too starchy and filling), mozzarella sticks (bland), or flatbread (sad and tiny). What I liked were the cheese dip (chips were too salty), potstickers (order them well done), & boneless wings. The wings were juicy & crispy. I tried the PB&J sauce--it reminds me of Thai flavors which I like. The bbq sauces are the best from what people say.  I'd also recommend to put in an order or two ahead of time. Service is known as a hit-or-miss, but my server was nice and fast.
Late night meal...endless appetizers and cocktails (on the rocks of course). Perfect way to end the weekend with my queen. TGI Fridays...#wegotalotofpoints...

Late night trip for drinks and apps. Didn't really love anything about this experience. The endless apps, were just so-so. I normally enjoy the green bean fries, but tonight they were luke warm at best. I didn't enjoy my drink either, I would not put it in the mojito category. Very weak and not much flavor. Overall, the experience was average at best..

Ok I just went here today and the service was horrible. It took 30 minutes for a appetizer to come out. Then I had the awards card and you get free chips and salsa, in which I did not. I even asked the waiter for them TWICE and still did not receive them... This is enough said, just don't go here period. UNLESS you thrive on shitty service then feel free to go here.

Decided to try them again after a year ago. Waited 30 minutes, saw a lot of empty tables so they are slow to clean up the tables. Once we were seated, our server was right over and pretty quick to serve our drink orders. We ordered an appetizer, a salad, and two entrees. The breaded Jack Daniels chicken app was over fried but the rest of the meal was very good. Only minor issue was the side spinach is served with lots of onions and mushrooms, but since it doesn't say that on the menu, my dining partner had to pick them out as he doesn't eat those. You'd expect a side dish of saute spinach to just be spinach. Steak fries were good, as were the sweet potato fries. His steak was cooked just right but my mahi mahi was a bit bland.

Extemely disappointed. Went here for lunch with family. We had to wait for a few minutes to be seated even though there were very few customers inside when we arrived. We then followed the host to three different sections of the restaurant while he decided where to seat us. Once seated it took nearly 10 minutes for our server (Stephen) to arrive and we ordered drinks. Another 10 minutes to get the drinks. We ordered our food and that took about 45 minutes to arrive. Meanwhile my iced tea tasted funky and I asked for coffee instead. That took about 10 mins. We had ordered burgers and fries. When the food finally came, both our fries were cold. We flagged down the waiter and he did come back with hot fries, but only one order. We had to wait another 20 minutes for our check. The food didn't even taste that good and it was freezing cold in there. I will not go back to this restaurant.
Absolutely one of the worst run Friday's you will ever encounter, go somewhere else if you're looking to eat!

I haven't been to Friday's in years and generally don't eat at chain restaurants. My husband received a gift card for Friday's, so we decided to stop in for a late lunch on Friday afternoon. We were both pleasantly surprised by both the good lunch and service. I had a black bean burger and fries, and my husband had ribs. We both remarked about the cleanliness of the restaurant as well. I don't know that we'll be back any time soon, because we have a lot of favorite restaurants in the area. But if you're looking for a chain restaurant with plenty of good menu choices, I think you'll be pleased with Friday's.

Even more terrible than you might imagine. Smells old and nasty even after the remodel. Friday's could simply revert back to what it was in 1990 and it would be far better. Menu choices are limited and dishes are poorly designed. Even the semi healthy stuff is soaked in butter (e.g. salmon) or full of sweet yuck (e.g, pecan crusted chicken salad). If you usually order ground up dead cow you might not notice (except for the smell). Closes early. What? Not sure why anyone would ever comes here. Find a Chili's or go to the slightly less mediocre Chsmpps down the street.
This is being nice . The food is bad and the service is worse. These people have no idea why they are still open

Only one star because I can't put zero. Bathrooms were not very clean, took WAY too long for them to clear a table for six in a half-full restaurant, never even took our drink orders before 4 sets of silverware were thrown at us. Four sets of silverware that ants were crawling out of. Needless to say, we left that restaurant despite the annoyed look on one of the staff member's faces. Never again
Besides the Roach that crawled across my table , the food was terrible., and I had a salad ! Stay clear people !

Don't come here often but this visit has been the worst.  It took 20 minutes to get our drinks..an extra 10 for straws and then when we got our food an hour later it was cold...probably died in the pass as our waiter was scrambling around the resturant trying to apologize for the rest of his angry tables.  We never got our son's spaghetti or a ceaser salad that was ordered as a side dish...won't be coming back here anytime soon and definitely won't be getting served by this waiter.

I used to love Fridays years ago but things have really changed.  French onion soup was in a small bowl ( not crock ) with no pieces on onion. Just broth and very soggy pieces of white bread and some cheese not even broiled and crispy.  The quesadilla was soggy and not crispy.

Meh - no more nachos on the menu and an overall greasy dinner.  The shrimp & chicken dish I had was good if it weren't drowned in grease - even the poor veggies didn't have a chance.  My friend had chips w melted cheese!  At least they only charged hr $2.99!  I liked the mozzarella  sticks - almost as good as the plating.  Id only go back for dessert bc the lush brownie dessert from eons ago is still on there.

Ate dinner tonight and had the half rack of ribs. Less than 12 fries on the plate, cole slaw was not cold....how long was it outside refrigeration the ribs (5 at most) were delicious but not enough for what they charge. Very disappointed.
Awful. Place was dirty. Hostess ignored us for 7 minutes while on a personal call and food was eh - don't think we'll be coming back.

First time at this particular Friday's. I ordered my usual the garlic Parmesan wings but they were not hitting tonight. The waitress was nice but not very attentive. There were periods if time were she forgot about us. Then it took forever to get her attention to get the check.

On 4/14/17 Applebee's on Route 73 I took my family out around 5:30 if for dinner it was eight of us at a table they sat us down pretty quick our waiter came out to car orders for drinks brought our drinks to the table left without giving the straws forgot my 3 kids drinks took another 15 to 20 minutes to bring the kids drinks took our order we literally waited an hour to get our appetizer I got a little frustrated my kids were hungry I told the manager we were leaving he said okay good luck didn't even care that we were picking up and leaving was very upset because my kids were hungry for waiting over an hour and still no food I would never ever come to this TGI Fridays ever again very bad experience I'm so upset can't believe service was so bad was not expecting that I had to give one start to write a review I wouldn't give any would not recommend this to any of my friends or anyone that's reading this drive right by it don't attempt to go there if you're trying to have a nice dinner with your family once we left we went to Applebee's on Route 73 they sat us down right away took our order how do I appetizers within 15 minutes our service was great Applebee's on Route 73 highly recommend that place

What's the deal with this place??? The host is on the phone there / then starts high five  and gets into talking all kinds of un related stuff with an apparent friend while leaving me waiting at the the door 15 minutes. Another server comes by and not a word or look. Meanwhile the place is more than half empty. Still in the lot as i write this as I want to do while fresh in my mind!!' It used to be so great - now it is what it. Bye - going to Applebee's down the street.

Why isn't 0 stars an option???? I had the worst service here from start to finish. They should be embarrassed to even operate this restaurant. The hostess crossed my name off but never called my parties name after waiting almost a half hour.. and half of the tables were empty while we were waiting. We waited 40 minutes for a nachos appetizer- and called the manager over who said they would give us the nachos for free. Then, 2 minutes after our nachos came our main food came out so we had no time to enjoy our appetizer. The waitress was impossible to track down and unapologetic after "forgetting" to comp our nachos. The saddest part was that the manager didn't even flinch when multiple tables were calling him over: it's like he knows how terrible the service is at this place. Will never go back!!!!!

The waitress was really sweet to my babies and made them feel really special. I wasn't going to mention the well done steak that was supposed to be medium but she spotted it. She even made a thing of it and went to the manager to get it compensated me. She was very very nice.

I've been to a Fridays before, but this was my first time to this specific location. We wanted to grab a drink and quick bite around 5pm on a Wednesday and we were able to get a good seat at the bar. Along with our drinks, we snacked on the green bean fries and the pretzels with dipping sauce. The GBF's were tasty, lightly battered and really good with the wasabi ranch. But the pretzel app.. that was pretty freaking delicious. Like, seriously good. The pretzels themselves were hot, fluffy and salty. The dipping sauce was creamy with bacon and scallions on top making it a perfect combination. I will be back just to get those pretzels again. The bartenders were quick and friendly. I applaud them for putting up with *the* most high maintenance customer I have probably ever seen in my life. I'm a little bit surprised they didn't scold her for painting her finger nails at the bar!! We were sitting there and I start smelling something off.. nail polish. What idiot paints their nails in the bar? This isn't your house, lady! And her demands of customizing every single thing she wanted to get...yeesh! Anyway, moral of the story, cheap beer and very delicious pretzels.

I could spend the time and effort listing all of the things wrong with this restaurant chain like the quality of the food, the absence of service, the feeling of stomach explosion and grease sweats post meal. However, I'll save both of us the time, and simply state, avoid at all costs (literally though, wouldn't even go again if it was free..).
This restaurant is just awful! We had a relatively new server who was clueless! Even the manager who came over couldn't get our order right. We will never go back!

I should've suspected something to find this restaurant empty on Father's Day, while all the other places were crowded. Mediocre food, very slow service! Maybe it's time to just close this place, and let a restaurant take over. Save your time, and more importantly, your money! Don't bother stopping here!

WOW, was the service slow and in attentive.  I was only able to get 1 soda because my wait never stopped by after taking my order.  Other people stopped by to bring my drink and food.  The wait finally stopped by to give my check, but I was in the mood for some dessert, which seem to bother her.  Overall the food was good, though I was disappointed with the small size and Little Debbie flavor of the brownie with ice cream.

Wow, I should have read the reviews first. Went to the AMC movie at 4 and thought "hey let's grab something to eat here". Bad decision. We were waited on in a reasonable amount of time. Ordered drinks and looked at the menu. Everything is much to expensive for this type of restaurant. $22.49 for a rack of JD ribs?? The waitress came back to the table to take our order and we reminded her that we hadn't received our drinks yet. She took our food order and disappeared! 20 minutes before we received our drinks. Did I mention the place was fairly empty. I was thinking of going to the bar and getting them myself! She finally brought our drinks and apologized, and offered complimentary chips and salsa. After about another 25 minutes our food arrived...but we had no silverware. she said she would get them for us. Then proceeded to check on the tables down the row. My wife had enough and went in search of silverware. Happened to run into the manager who brought them over promptly. He tried to joke about how it was a new policy that customers had to eat with their hands. Not amused. I told him it was ridiculous to have to wait 20 minutes for drinks. He agreed and offered 50% off our food bill. Very generous but this place will never last when customers have to wait all the time. Won't be going back.

Worse service ever. Over an hour for a drink and a salad. We were seated immediately but at least 10 minutes before anyone came to the table. Salad took at least 30 minutes. Had to eat quickly because we an event to go to. Millionaire Cobb salad had no kale as described on menu. Plate felt dirty. Never asked if we wanted another drink. Bathroom dirty. When manager came by and asked how things were my husband said things were  slow. Nothing changed. Waitress finally came by and dropped our check off. After we watched her drop off drinks, take an order, put the order in, pick up her tip on another table, I literally had to ask her as she walked past our table if we could get our check and my credit card.

Yuck yuck and more yuck. Went into for a drink and the stink of the bar mats hits you in the face. Waited for a long long time for bartender - no more than 8 people's at bar. Ordered one of their specials and it was such a heavy handed poor I had to send it back. The guy even left without telling us - that's good because the tip was weak. Not because I'm cheap but the second person who served us was a girl who was friendly but again served horrible drinks in warm glasses!

If I could give this zero stars I would. The food was cold when we specifically asked for our food to be hot because the food was cold last time. Secondly, we got the endless appetizers when it was supposed to be 10 dollars each but we got charged 13 dollars each. On the non updated menu it states that the potato skins are still apart of the endless appetizers when in fact they are NOT, the menus should be updated or we should have been informed. The area under our booth was very messy it was not swept up so there was trash under our feet. When it came time to pay the waitress disappeared for fifteen minutes so we could not pay the way we wanted to. We asked for extra napkins and only received two, when we asked for more appetizers she cut us off and we could not complete the order, also when I tried to order dessert there was no menu offered. Very unpleasant experience. 100% will not be coming back.

Save yourself the money and the frustration and never come here. I've been eating here since at least 2010 and wow are things just god awful. Got seated by 2 confused hostesses and was finally approached by the waitress about 10 minutes later. Mind you, it's 5:00 on a Wednesday and there's us and about 8 other tables in the whole restaurant. We ordered their new loaded chicken nachos for an appetizer. It took her 15 minutes to tell us that they "can't do nachos". For an entree I ordered a French onion soup and a side chicken Caesar salad. The soup just tasted like salt and the cheese wasn't even melted. The salad came with no chicken and when I asked if I could get a plate of chicken the waitress just looked at me but eventually said "yeah". 10 minutes later she comes back out and says there was a mix up in the kitchen and told me it would take them 7 minutes to cook me chicken. As the rest of my family is 3/4 of the way done their meals (a bacon burger and chicken fingers) i decline the offer. The manager came over and talked to us and made sure we wouldn't be charged for the things that we ordered but never received. Our waitress slaps the bill down and says "they took the chips off" (no shit, we didn't get them) and then walks away. We never got a refill the whole meal. There's bertuccis down the road and a chipotle opening up soon...spend your money on one of them

I don't know WHY I tried this place more than once.  The first time, the food tasted old, it smells disgusting and service was extremely slow.  THIS time, we sat down and waited for 15 minutes to give our drink order (a coke, water with lemon and I believe a lemonade) which took another 10 minutes.  While we waited, we looked at the STICKY menu and decided what to eat.  When the waitress finally came back to take our order, we gave her our orders.  I ordered last.  I asked for the Jack Daniels sampler and the waitress says, "Oh I'm sorry.  We're out of ribs."  Wait...WHAT?  So at no time during the 30-35 minutes we've been sitting here did it cross your mind to let us know that?  That was it for us.  We said never mind and left.  We offered to pay for the drinks but she comped them.  NEVER again will we go to that TGI Fridays.  Way too much of a hassle.

Waited 30 minutes for appetizers and the waitress didn't bring plates. 15 minutes later plates came. 1-1/2 hours and the food finally came. Every single Fridays I've been to is like this in every state. I need to stop going to any of them.

Experienced terribly slow service on two occasions when it wasn't crowded.  Pretty decent bar food, all things considered.. but that doesn't make up for the serious long wait times to place an order, refill drinks, and wait for a check.

If I could give 0 stars I would. We came in for dinner tonight for the first and last time. It took about 8 minutes for the hostess to come over, there was another couple waiting when we came in. The hostess seated them, then us. We were seated for 15 minutes then the other couple left, we waited about 5 more minutes, I asked the hostess to see the manager, she said she will be right over, obviously she wasn't listening to what I said. After about 6 more minutes the server came over very apologetic said she was by herself she was running all over the place and that the other servers just came in. We ordered our drinks and waited 10 more minutes and then we got up and left too. I am a server so that's why I waited that long.. but seriously 44 minutes is ridiculous..We went to Chipotle.. My salad was yummy :)

Tonight I ordered from this Friday's via GrubHub, and it was a terrible experience. Friday's gave the GrubHub driver the wrong order. We called, and Friday's wouldn't even confirm if the order was still at the restaurant. We were told a manager would call us back, which never happened.  We called back and spoke to someone else at Friday's, and she said GrubHub never sent a driver, and I explained the situation and was put on hold. Luckily the GrubHub driver was very helpful and went back to Friday's and showed up while I was on hold.  Thanks to GrubHub we got the (now cold) order but the Friday's shirked all responsibility and was either unwilling or unable to help remedy the situation.  I had a very similar incident happen with a takeout order via GrubHub at this Friday's location as well, so I get the impression this wasn't a one off situation.

Our server was a guy called Ashton. Made sure to ask him his name, because of his outstanding customer service skills. I am rating off of customer service skills, as I was not too thrilled with the food. The sweet potato fries weren't tasty and the fried shrimps were too cold...not fresh.  I would have rated with five stars if the food was on-point. Location is ok, as this is my first time here. I think they could do more with the cleanliness, but other than that, happy with the customer service that we were given, as it is extremely important.

Can't believe this got thru 2 people to serve this burnt dish. Fries were hard as rocks.  Service was terrible. Understand ifs it's crowded but 8 people at the bar with 2 bartenders. Used my same glass. Gave one star for cold beer
horrible. here an hour no food. no one has food. i dont think hassan is going to last. no support. 20 minutes for lemonade. wtf.

Booked a week in advance for a local soccer tournament and after 2 hours, the kids weren't even served. Try keeping 20 13 year olds in line without food or drinks for two hours. When an adult approached management, they were told, "you are killing my kitchen." What???? Who says that? This isn't a mom and pop shop unprepared for big crowds. Unacceptable.

This place is horrible! And the management is TERRIBLE! Kim Gonzalez is the manger here and she was COMPLETELY disrespectful!! Her waitress named Becca, was very rude and made things go left! Police was called for no reason and my family and I were so embarrassed! I'm defiantly calling corporate because these people are horrible & I love Fridays, but after tonight Friday's will NEVER receive any of my money! I can't believe I was treated this way. DO NOT COME TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT! Kim is a horrible manager and Becca's attitude is ridiculous!

I have been going to TGI Fridays for YEARS.  My husband prefers Applebee's because of their half price drink specials after 10 but we decided to go to TGI Fridays because we wanted a change.  We had never been to this location, but it being a chain restaurant, how much variation could there be?? Right?  Wrong!  After out experience here, I WILL NEVER RETURN TO THIS LOCATION.  I visited the ladies restroom which was absolutely atrocious.  Looked, smelled, WAS dirty.  After using the restroom, my appetite was altered somewhat.  Kinda brought me back to my wild college days when you would use the restroom in the club that had the door half torn off with disgusting wet floors.  It reminded me of that! Ordered the food.  First up was french onion soup.  It had these two stale baguette slices with one paper thin slice of cheese on it.  I mean really?  French onion soup crocks are supposed to have a slab of gooey melty cheese over the bowl, not a drizzle of cheese on stale bread.  The broth itself was decent, albeit a bit salty.   My husband's beer was sour.  He never complains about food, but in this instance he felt it necessary to tell the bar tender to TURN OFF THE TAP.  He said that if people drank that beer it would make them sick. My meal was the sizzling chicken and shrimp with cheese or whatever its called.  Usually, this is my FAVORITE MEAL EVER at Fridays.  This concoction they served was a disaster.  The shrimp is supposed to be served over a marinara bruschetta.  They basically took the marinara sauce they use for mozzarella sticks and poured it over the shrimp. NO.  THIS IS NOT HOW IT IS SUPPOSED TO BE.  I know this from years of patronizing other TGI Fridays and enjoying their delicious chicken and shrimp with cheese dish.  Plus, my chicken tasted like it was microwaved.  It was rubbery and tough and disgusting.  My husband ordered the Jack Daniel's chicken and had the same complaint.  My mashed potatoes tasted like they were made with dehydrated potatoes and not mixed properly.  We brought it to our servers attention how the food was not the best and immediately her whole demeanor changed like we were going to ask for money off the bill or not tip her or something.  But we are not that way (although we could have been) and it is sad to see that response from our server. Considering how terrible the food was, you would expect it to be an off day midweek no?  Well, guess what?  This actually occurred on a Friday when Friday's is supposed to be jumping and busy and they did not bring their A game.  Shame on you Fridays.  If I wasn't so lazy I would report their terrible food to corporate. In sum, I do not recommend this location as their food (and bathrooms) are subpar and make the whole TGI Fridays look bad.

Decided to come to Friday's to have the endless appetizers, first price went up to $15, second now you only get 3-4 choices and one of them is dumplings,  who the heck eats that, so disappointed, aside from that waited at least 10 minutes to be seated then another 7-8 minutes for the waiter to come to our table, that's it done with Friday's
this place has terrible service and the food was ice cold. then they offered me a free dessert and it took twenty minutes to come out

Friends and I decided to go for drinks on a Saturday after Yoga. The place was not crowded around 5p. We sat at the bar. The bartender was attentive at first. My friends ordered drinks; neither drink tasted like it had alcohol. We ordered a side salad and pot stickers (they forgot our bread with the salad). We were helped by 3 different ppl in the 2 hours we were there. Overall an okay experience but definitely not my favorite place for drinks and apps.
